abstract.p: Casey Jones is named executive president of Grey Global Group; Jorge Vazquez is named to additional posts of chairman and chief executive at new unit of True North Diversified Cos in Argentina; other ad executive changes (S)

block.p: Casey Jones was named to the new post of executive vice president and managing director for technology at the Grey Global Group, based in San Francisco, with global management responsibility for the Oracle account, which has billings estimated at $100 million, as well as responsiblity for integrated marketing for future technology-related clients. Mr. Jones had been a senior vice president and senior account director at Euro RSCG DSW Partners, Salt Lake City, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising.

Casey Jones was named to the new post of executive vice president and managing director for technology at the Grey Global Group, based in San Francisco, with global management responsibility for the Oracle account, which has billings estimated at $100 million, as well as responsiblity for integrated marketing for future technology-related clients. Mr. Jones had been a senior vice president and senior account director at Euro RSCG DSW Partners, Salt Lake City, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising.

* Jorge Vazquez, president at Bozell Vazquez, Buenos Aires, part of True North Communications, was named to the additional posts of chairman and chief executive at a new umbrella unit of the True North Diversified Cos., Argentina, which will include the following agencies owned or majority owned by True North: BDZ Interactive, Bozell Vazquez, Communicom and Marketing Drive Worldwide. * John Padgett was named executive vice president and chief media officer at Fitzgerald & Co., Atlanta, part of the Interpublic Group of Cos., succeeding Nik Mainthia, who became executive vice president and media director at BBDO South, Atlanta, part of the BBDO Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group. Mr. Padgett had been national media manager at the Coca-Cola Co., Atlanta. * Gene Daly, executive vice president at Ketchum Directory Advertising, Chicago, part of the Omnicom Group, was named president there. He succeeds John Joseph, who resigned. * Bob DeBartolo was named to the vacant post as head of Potentia Partners, Chicago, a health care agency of the Frank J. Corbett unit of the Omnicom Group, as managing director. He had been executive vice president at the Chicago office of Salu.net. * Kathleen Brookbanks, managing partner and executive media director at the Chicago office of Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, was named to head a new Chicago office of Mindshare, as managing director. Mindshare is the media services joint venture of Ogilvy and J. Walter Thompson; both are owned by the WPP Group.
